info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:18PM CDT until July 08 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM MDT/700 PM CDT/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN CHEYENNE...NORTHWESTERN THOMAS AND CENTRAL SHERMAN COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 516 PM MDT/616 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles south of Bird City to 10 miles north of Goodland, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...At 550 PM CDT the public reported 1 inch hail and estimated 70 mph winds in St. Francis. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Goodland, Brewster and Edson. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 10 and 36. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
